1.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
{YHWH}
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, heed; by implication, purpose (sake or account); used adverbially to indicate the reason or cause
to rub with oil, i.e. to anoint; by implication, to consecrate; also to paint
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, to be fresh, i.e. full (rosy, (figuratively) cheerful); to announce (glad news)
depressed (figuratively), in mind (gentle) or circumstances (needy, especially saintly)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
to wrap firmly (especially a turban, compress, or saddle); figuratively, to stop, to rule
to burst (literally or figuratively)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
to transport into captivity
freedom; hence, spontaneity of outflow, and so clear
to yoke or hitch; by analogy, to fasten in any sense, to join battle
opening (of a dungeon), i.e. jail-delivery (figuratively, salvation for sin)
opening (of a dungeon), i.e. jail-delivery (figuratively, salvation for sin)

2.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
a year (as a revolution of time)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

3.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
lamenting
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
an embellishment, i.e. fancy head-dress
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
ashes
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness
cheerfulness; specifically, welcome
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
lamentation
a vestment
laudation; specifically (concretely) a hymn
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
feeble, obscure
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, strength; hence, anything strong; specifically a chief (politically); also a ram (from his strength); a pilaster (as a strong support); an oak or other strong tree
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
something planted, i.e. the place (a garden or vineyard), or the thing (a plant, figuratively or men); by implication, the act, planting
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to gleam, i.e. (causatively) embellish; figuratively, to boast; also to explain (i.e. make clear) oneself; to shake a tree

4.brief: properly, drought, i.e. (by implication) a desolation
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
first, in place, time or rank (as adjective or noun)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to be new; causatively, to rebuild
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling

5.brief: to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
foreign, or (concretely) a foreigner, or (abstractly) heathendom

6.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
to attend as a menial or worshipper; figuratively, to contribute to

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
to exchange; by implication, to change places

7.brief: the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
shame (the feeling and the condition, as well as its cause); by implication (specifically) an idol
properly, a repetition, i.e. a duplicate (copy of a document), or a double (in amount); by implication, a second (in order, rank, age, quality or location)
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, a repetition, i.e. a duplicate (copy of a document), or a double (in amount); by implication, a second (in order, rank, age, quality or location)
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

8.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
a step or (collectively, stairs, as ascending); usually a holocaust (as going up in smoke)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)

9.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

10.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
a robe (i.e. upper and outer garment)
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
a relative by marriage (especially through the bride); figuratively, a circumcised child (as a species of religious espousal)
to officiate as a priest; figuratively, to put on regalia
a bride (as if perfect); hence, a son's wife
to advance, i.e. pass on or continue; causatively, to remove; specifically, to bedeck (i.e. bring an ornament upon)
something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon)

11.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
a sprout (usually concrete), literal or figurative
to sprout (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
to sprout (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative)
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
